definition: to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: The sectarian thinks that he has the sea ladled into his private pond.
sentences.chinese: 自私偏狹者以爲他能將滄海之水全部舀進自己的池塘。

sentences.english: The idea was outlandish only to the innocent.
sentences.chinese: 只是對不明就裏的人而言，這一想法是偏狹的。

sentences.english: Multi-cultural London triumphed over provincial Paris.
sentences.chinese: 多文化的倫敦戰勝了思想偏狹的巴黎。

sentences.english: Intolerance stingy, opportunity is less, the world is small.
sentences.chinese: 偏狹小氣，機會便少了，世界也小了。

sentences.english: It was a typical case of British chauvinism and insularity.
sentences.chinese: 這是典型的英國沙文主義和偏狹心理的事例。

sentences.english: It wasn't until then that I realized how close-minded I had been.
sentences.chinese: 那時我才意識到之前的觀念是多麼偏狹。

definition: to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
hard to tell if it's real or sham
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
